tweets.text:
We've  teams out across the region inspecting our assets  preparing for the forecast of heavy rain. 

These photos are from Todmorden, Calderdale where we're bolstering our flood defences as a precaution.

Sign up to our free flood warning service  https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb
#Floods https://t.co/kwonQEXVFv

Ahead of heavy rain anticipated over the coming few days, our Officers are currently installing temporary defences in Ribchester, #Lancashire. 

#beprepared #floodaware https://t.co/gGR0EsIdPP

We're excited to release a podcast for #LondonRiversWeek with @ThamesEstPart @EnvAgency & @SE_Rivers_Trust. tweets.text: We have Officers out in the North West installing temporary flood defences and clearing grids. Check your flood risk and keep up to date on the latest situation: https://t.co/FSRywjlIeM https://t.co/7oNomodTmU
It was wonderful to meet with @StaffsWildlife and the @EnvAgency this morning to see the excellent success of the Sunrise Project and the re-routing of the river Trent. https://t.co/YU9R4VwC3j

Great to show @jogideon around the #StaffsSUNRISE Victoria Ground project this morning with our partners @EnvAgencyMids. We talked about the need for a #GreenRecovery and how restoring our urban green spaces is good for the economy, improves air quality and health and wellbeing. https://t.co/Ema144Pojj

Trying to predict flood risk for friends by rivers based on forecast rainfall and experience from Storms Ciara and Dennis in February this year. The @Shoothill @GaugeMap service is so important for this. It gives communities usable access to @EnvAgency data. #floods #cumbria https://t.co/tRzwoXXBbb
Crazy weather on #Greenwich Peninsula! ‚òîÔ∏è‚ö°Ô∏èüå© eerie light and a huge hailstorm wasn‚Äôt fun to get caught in... but looked pretty! https://t.co/SOm9ThDDgj

Don‚Äôt go into the water!
A range of nasty chemicals are ‚Äòubiquitous in the environment‚Äô and have caused all England‚Äôs rivers to fail to meet legal health standards. Remind me again about that precautionary principle... https://t.co/JbjQeAxxUr https://t.co/9S2ygbuYZr

urls.title: Fly tipping
urls.description: You face an unlimited fine if your waste is fly-tipped. Use a licensed carrier or take your waste to a registered site. Report a fly tip. Check a licence.

tweets.text:
Having a clear out? If you're paying someone to take away your waste, don't get spooked by a fine.  Check they are properly licensed by @EnvAgency with advice at https://t.co/UGmkASYNep 

#ResponsibleRubbish  #dutyofcare https://t.co/uNViD9Bi8b

#Communication of #ESBL and #NDM Escherichia coli (#Superbugs) between #Animals and #Farm #Workers. https://t.co/6TkEs1hJKp
#SafeFarming #Safe_LiveStock

21 containers of illegally exported waste sent to Sri Lanka have successfully returned to England.

We will investigate who exported this #WasteCrime. 

Those responsible could face 2 years in prison, and an unlimited fine.

Read more here: https://t.co/ti1Wt6XYYP https://t.co/a347mSYEpi

annotations.normalized_text: LEP's Business Resilience and Recovery Scheme

tweets.text:
With the support of a grant from the LEP's Business Resilience and Recovery Scheme, Ipswich business DXB Pump & Power was able to diversify and start a new contract for the @EnvAgency during Covid-19.
https://t.co/CBeqoiiPlM
#Funding #Grants #businesssupport

Had a really interesting morning being shown Chalgrove's brooks and backwaters by the indefatigable Jan. Lots to learn and lots to see #flooding #watermill #trout #otters #bats #waterquality (most of these were hiding)! @thameswater @EnvAgency @WildOxfordshire https://t.co/aW5GHkc2iY

Jeremy has been working with the community in #Lewisham to make a flood storage area along the river #Quaggy a haven for wildlife.
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/CZOrbOW1S1
